intro: Pleuranthodium corniculatum, commonly known as the horned pleuranthodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like bracts that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the warmer months. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
